comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: "The Amerika, the largest ship in the world, is 687 feet long, 74 feet 6 inches wide, and 53 feet deep. She can carry about 4,000 passengers and crew." (Hamburg-American Steamship Line) – NY Times reporting on maiden voyage, October 11, 1905. "USS America (ID # 3006), 1917-1919. Originally the German passenger liner Amerika (1905-1917). Later the U.S. Army Transport America (1919-1920), the U.S.passenger liner America (1921-1940) and the U.S. Army Transport Edmund B. Alexander (1940-1957)" – Dept of the Navy

comment.author: 7471115@N08
comment._content: I concur - according to references by Arnold Kludas, she was originally the German Amerika, and after being seized by the US upon declaration of war with Germany, was renamed the America.

comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: She also was, in 1913, no longer the largest ship in the world -- the Imperator was, which probably explains all the pictures of its maiden voyage to NYC and the juxtaposition of this picture with it.
